result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernadette M Teska was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
Concurrent with: Refusal Ozaukee Co. case 15TR2212

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 02-12-2016 08:30 am

Matter set for final status before trial. Defendant Bernadette M Teska in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Court gives recommendation: $500 fine plus costs; 120 days jail; 18 months revocation of license; 18 months IID; Assessment. Jury trial removed from court calendar.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
